alert.note: Alert for Seminole (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 07 at 8:34AM EST until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The Saint Johns River at Sanford is forecast to remain in Minor Flood Stage through the weekend. Potential impacts from Subtropical Storm Nicole will cause river levels to hold steady over the next several days near 6.5 feet with rainfall and increasing winds preventing a further decline. For the St. Johns River...including Sanford...Minor flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 945 PM EST. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River Near Sanford. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 6.5 feet, Water enters a few lower lying homes in the Stone Island and Stillbrook subdivisions. The road into Stone Island becomes impassable. Water rises onto low lying property near Sanford. Parks and docks are flooded near Lake Monroe. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 AM EST Monday was 6.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Sat St Johns River Sanford 5.5 6.5 Mon 7 am 6.5 6.4 6.4 6.5 6.5 &&
